paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses two mutations in the TTR gene: Val142Ile and Ser43Asn, focusing on their clinical characteristics and penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Mean age 42.2 (SD=18.2), 3 women and 7 men from Colombia

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Val142Ile carriers often request medical attention for neurological symptoms consistent with hATTR-PN.
Val142Ile carriers often request medical attention for neurological symptoms consistent with hATTR-PN.

functional_data.summary: Val142Ile carriers showed lower performance in the right NHP test and greater sensitivity to cold pain.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and functional assessments.
variants.additional_notes: The Val142Ile mutation is more common in individuals of African descent.
key_quotes: Val142Ile carriers showed lower performance in the right NHP test and greater sensitivity to cold pain in hand and leg.
The Val142Ile mutation, more common in individuals of African descent, is predominantly associated with development of heart disease.

patients.demographics: Mean age 37.76 (SD=14.7), 11 women and 14 men from Ecuador

functional_data.summary: Less severe neurological impairment compared to Val142Ile carriers.

variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: The Ser43Asn mutation is identified as a rare mutation with potential isolated cardiac phenotypes.
key_quotes: The Ser43Asn mutation, found in both Italy and Ecuador, where it may be endemic, is identified as a rare mutation with potential isolated cardiac phenotypes.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text and included individual records.
